construct_conditions_from_arguments(attribute_names, arguments)

[Source]

    # File vendor/plugins/spatial_adapter/lib/post_gis_adapter.rb, line 25
25:     def self.construct_conditions_from_arguments(attribute_names, arguments)
26:       conditions = []
27:       attribute_names.each_with_index do |name, idx| 
28:         if columns_hash[name].is_a?(SpatialColumn)
29:           #when the discriminating column is spatial, always use the && (bounding box intersection check) operator : the user can pass either a geometric object (which will be transformed to a string using the quote method of the database adapter) or an array representing 2 opposite corners of a bounding box

30:           if arguments[idx].is_a?(Array)
31:             bbox = arguments[idx]
32:             conditions << "#{table_name}.#{connection.quote_column_name(name)} && SetSRID(?::box3d, #{bbox[2] || DEFAULT_SRID} ) " 
33:             #Could do without the ? and replace directly with the quoted BBOX3D but like this, the flow is the same everytime

34:             arguments[idx]= "BOX3D(" + bbox[0].join(" ") + "," + bbox[1].join(" ") + ")"
35:           else
36:             conditions << "#{table_name}.#{connection.quote_column_name(name)} && ? " 
37:           end
38:         else
39:           conditions << "#{table_name}.#{connection.quote_column_name(name)} #{attribute_condition(arguments[idx])} " 
40:         end
41:       end
42:       [ conditions.join(" AND "), *arguments[0...attribute_names.length] ]
43:     end
get_conditions(attrs)

Vit Ondruch & Tilmann Singer ‘s patch

[Source]

    # File vendor/plugins/spatial_adapter/lib/post_gis_adapter.rb, line 46
46:     def self.get_conditions(attrs)
47:       attrs.map do |attr, value|
48:         attr = attr.to_s
49:         if columns_hash[attr].is_a?(SpatialColumn)
50:           if value.is_a?(Array)
51:             attrs[attr.to_sym]= "BOX3D(" + value[0].join(" ") + "," + value[1].join(" ") + ")"
52:             "#{table_name}.#{connection.quote_column_name(attr)} && SetSRID(?::box3d, #{value[2] || DEFAULT_SRID} ) " 
53:           elsif value.is_a?(Envelope)
54:             attrs[attr.to_sym]= "BOX3D(" + value.lower_corner.text_representation + "," + value.upper_corner.text_representation + ")"
55:             "#{table_name}.#{connection.quote_column_name(attr)} && SetSRID(?::box3d, #{value.srid} ) " 
56:           else
57:             "#{table_name}.#{connection.quote_column_name(attr)} && ? " 
58:           end
59:         else
60:           "#{table_name}.#{connection.quote_column_name(attr)} #{attribute_condition(value)}"
61:         end
62:       end.join(' AND ')
63:     end

add_index(table_name,column_name,options = {})

Adds a GIST spatial index to a column. Its name will be <table_name>_<column_name>_spatial_index unless the key :name is present in the options hash, in which case its value is taken as the name of the index.

[Source]

     # File vendor/plugins/spatial_adapter/lib/post_gis_adapter.rb, line 166
166:   def add_index(table_name,column_name,options = {})
167:     index_name = options[:name] || index_name(table_name,:column => Array(column_name))
168:     if options[:spatial]
169:       execute "CREATE INDEX #{index_name} ON #{table_name} USING GIST (#{Array(column_name).join(", ")} GIST_GEOMETRY_OPS)"
170:     else
171:       index_type = options[:unique] ? "UNIQUE" : ""
172:       #all together

173:       execute "CREATE #{index_type} INDEX #{index_name} ON #{table_name} (#{Array(column_name).join(", ")})"
174:     end
175:   end
column_spatial_info(table_name)

[Source]

     # File vendor/plugins/spatial_adapter/lib/post_gis_adapter.rb, line 258
258:   def column_spatial_info(table_name)
259:     constr = query "SELECT * FROM geometry_columns WHERE f_table_name = '\#{table_name}'\n"
260:     
261:     raw_geom_infos = {}
262:     constr.each do |constr_def_a|
263:        raw_geom_infos[constr_def_a[3]] ||= ActiveRecord::ConnectionAdapters::RawGeomInfo.new
264:       raw_geom_infos[constr_def_a[3]].type = constr_def_a[6]
265:       raw_geom_infos[constr_def_a[3]].dimension = constr_def_a[4].to_i
266:       raw_geom_infos[constr_def_a[3]].srid = constr_def_a[5].to_i
267: 
268:       if raw_geom_infos[constr_def_a[3]].type[-1] == ?M
269:         raw_geom_infos[constr_def_a[3]].with_m = true
270:         raw_geom_infos[constr_def_a[3]].type.chop!
271:       else
272:         raw_geom_infos[constr_def_a[3]].with_m = false
273:       end
274:     end
275: 
276:     raw_geom_infos.each_value do |raw_geom_info|
277:       #check the presence of z and m

278:       raw_geom_info.convert!
279:     end
280: 
281:     raw_geom_infos
282: 
283:   end
create_table(name, options = {}) {|table_definition| ...}

[Source]

     # File vendor/plugins/spatial_adapter/lib/post_gis_adapter.rb, line 114
114:   def create_table(name, options = {})
115:     table_definition = ActiveRecord::ConnectionAdapters::PostgreSQLTableDefinition.new(self)
116:     table_definition.primary_key(options[:primary_key] || "id") unless options[:id] == false
117:     
118:     yield table_definition
119:     
120:     if options[:force]
121:       drop_table(name) rescue nil
122:     end
123:     
124:     create_sql = "CREATE#{' TEMPORARY' if options[:temporary]} TABLE "
125:     create_sql << "#{name} ("
126:     create_sql << table_definition.to_sql
127:     create_sql << ") #{options[:options]}"
128:     execute create_sql
129:     
130:     #added to create the geometric columns identified during the table definition

131:     unless table_definition.geom_columns.nil?
132:       table_definition.geom_columns.each do |geom_column|
133:         execute geom_column.to_sql(name)
134:       end
135:     end
136:   end

     # File vendor/plugins/spatial_adapter/lib/post_gis_adapter.rb, line 139
139:   def remove_column(table_name,column_name, options = {})
140:     columns(table_name).each do |col|
141:       if col.name == column_name.to_s 
142:         #check if the column is geometric

143:         unless geometry_data_types[col.type].nil? or
144:                (options[:remove_using_dropgeometrycolumn] == false)
145:           execute "SELECT DropGeometryColumn('#{table_name}','#{column_name}')"
146:         else
147:           original_remove_column(table_name,column_name)
148:         end
149:       end
150:     end
151:   end
